result.execSummary:
The defendant Victoria L Metz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond on file to be first applied to Attorney Mann's fees. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victoria L Metz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: 2:34 pm case called. Defendant Victoria L Metz in court with attorney Jeffrey Allen Mann.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on record. State moves to amend 15CM341 to violation of Reckless Driving in violation of 346.62(2). Attorney Mann concurs.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Amended Ct 1 in 15CM341. No Contest to 15CM433. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in 15TR3149. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Mann.  Court sentences the defendant to: 15CM341-$400 fine inclusive of costs to be paid within 60 days. 15CM433- Impose 30 days WCJ, STAYED and places on probation for a period of 12 months. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. CONDITIONS: 3 days WCJ with credit for 3 days served. AODA and follow through. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Terms of Agent. Costs including Attorney Mann's fees to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeffrey Allen Mann in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mann requests matter be set for status-offer has been extended-need to confirm with client.  Status conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: 15CM-341 and 15CM-433 - Both Cases Called @ 1:18 PM: Defendant Victoria L Metz in court with attorney Jeffrey Allen Mann.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per ADA:  Communications continue with Atty Mann with further follow up necessary due to Toxicology Report.  State's requests add'l time to work toward resolution.  No objection by Atty Mann to adjournment.  Requests clarification of bond conditions imposed as to driving restrictions.  Counsel further argue bond condition as to driving.  The Court:  Will amend bond to permit operation of MV only with a valid DL having been informed at this point of the Hygiene Analysis.  Defendant may operate only if operation if legal.  Status conference scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 09:55 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:05 p.m. Defendant Victoria L Metz in court, in custody, appears via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  The court will appoint Atty Mann on this case as he is court appointed on the other pending matter.  NGP entered.  DA Blader requesting $1500 Cash Bond. No statement by DE regarding bond.  Court orders $1500 Cash Bond. STC to be scheduled with Attorney Mann.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.
